sentence.Network_en: This, I am sorry to say, is almost entirely wishful thinking.
sentence.Network_cn: 我很遗憾，这几乎完全是一厢情愿的想法。

sentence.Network_en: They are not entirely happy with his criticism of the president.
sentence.Network_cn: 他对总统的批评并没有让他们特别高兴。

sentence.Network_en: Mars has an insubstantial atmosphere, consisting almost entirely of carbon dioxide.
sentence.Network_cn: 火星的大气层极其稀薄，几乎全部由二氧化碳构成。

encyclopedia.content: 副词 adv. 1.全部地；完整地；完全地 a screen of trees thick enough to conceal the building entirely 稠密得足以遮蔽整座建筑的树林屏障 An entirely rigid system is impractical. 一套完全死板的体制是不实际的。 After bitter hand-to-hand combat,the enemy military camps were entirely destroyed. 经过一场短兵相接的激烈战斗，所有敌军营垒被摧毁了。 Are you sure you entirely apprehend the importance of complet

entry.def: Entirely means completely and not just partly.

example.ex: Fraud is an entirely different matter...
example.tran: 欺诈完全是另外一回事。

entry.def: Entirely is also used to emphasize what you are saying.

example.ex: Oh, the whole episode was entirely his fault.
example.tran: 天啊，整件事完全是他的错。

entry.tran: （尤用于表示批评时）不是特别，并非完全
entry.def: People sometimes use the expression not entirely to reduce the force of a strong statement, especially a critical one.

example.ex: They are not entirely happy with his criticism of the president...
example.tran: 他对总统的批评并没有让他们特别高兴。

example.ex: We shall see that this is not entirely true...
example.tran: 我们会明白这并非全是真的。

means.word_mean: 1. to a complete degree or to the full or entire extent (`whole' is often used informally for `wholly');

sentences.sentence: "it was completely different from what we expected"

means.word_mean: 2. without any others being included or involved;

sentences.sentence: "a school devoted entirely to the needs of problem children"
"the burden of proof rests on the prosecution alone"

auth_sentence.content: His modus operandi is entirely different to Faber's.

auth_sentence.content: This album was created entirely by Jaime and Mike.

Sentence.sentence: In the past, new ways of doing things online have not displaced the old ways entirely.
I try not to go online till my day's writing is finished, and I moved from Manhattan to rural Japan in part so I could more easily survive for long stretches entirely on foot.
Newly created state colleges and universities devoted themselves almost entirely to scientific, technological, and engineering fields.

sentences.en: a screen of trees thick enough to conceal the building entirely
sentences.cn: 稠密得足以遮蔽整座建筑的树林屏障

sentences.en: An entirely rigid system is impractical.
sentences.cn: 一套完全死板的体制是不实际的。

sentences.en: After bitter hand-to-hand combat,the enemy military camps were entirely destroyed.
sentences.cn: 经过一场短兵相接的激烈战斗,所有敌军营垒被摧毁了。

sentences.en: Are you sure you entirely apprehend the importance of completing these forms as accurately as possible?
sentences.cn: 你肯定你完全明白了尽可能准确地填写这些表格的重要性了吗?
